episodeTitle: The Showdown Has Come! Luffy's Desperate Last Attack!
description: Luffy battles Warden Magellan in a desperate attempt to reach Ace, but despite using Gear Second, he becomes completely engulfed in deadly poison. Meanwhile, Bentham (Mr. 2 Bon Clay) fights to rescue Buggy and Galdino (Mr. 3) from Vice Warden Hannyabal, declaring them friends worth saving.

events.title: Luffy vs Magellan - Final Showdown Begins
events.description: Luffy confronts Warden Magellan in a desperate battle to break through to Ace. Despite being heavily poisoned from their previous encounter, Luffy refuses to give up and charges at the warden with unwavering determination.
events.significance: This battle represents one of Luffy's most devastating defeats in the series, showing the limits of his power at this point and the immense sacrifice he's willing to make to save his brother.

quotes.text: I'm going to save Ace no matter what!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's declaration of his unwavering resolve to rescue his brother despite facing impossible odds

events.title: Magellan's Venom Blowfish
events.description: Magellan shoots a concentrated poison ball called Venom Blowfish (Doku Fugu) from his mouth. The deadly projectile forces Luffy to dodge, demonstrating another versatile application of Magellan's Doku Doku no Mi powers.
events.significance: Showcases the versatility of Magellan's poison abilities beyond close-range attacks, making him even more formidable as he can attack from a distance.

events.title: Luffy Activates Gear Second Against Magellan
events.description: In a desperate attempt to land a decisive blow, Luffy activates Gear Second, increasing his speed and power. He charges at Magellan with enhanced abilities, but the warden is prepared with his poison defenses.
events.significance: Demonstrates that even Luffy's enhanced Gear Second abilities are insufficient against Magellan's overwhelming poison, highlighting the vast gap in their current power levels.

events.title: Magellan's Hydra Poison Attack
events.description: Magellan summons his Hydra technique, creating a massive dragon-like formation of poison that completely engulfs Luffy. The attack is so powerful that it overwhelms even Luffy's determination and Gear Second speed.
events.significance: The Hydra represents one of Magellan's most powerful techniques and becomes the attack that ultimately defeats Luffy in this battle, covering him from head to toe in deadly poison.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Jet Twin Pistol
events.description: Using Gear Second, Luffy unleashes a Jet Twin Pistol attack, attempting to break through Magellan's poison defenses. He manages to blow the warden back momentarily, but the attack proves insufficient to defeat him.
events.significance: Shows Luffy using an enhanced dual-handed version of his Jet Pistol technique, but even this powerful attack cannot overcome Magellan's poison abilities.

quotes.text: Gomu Gomu no... Jet Twin Pistol!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's desperate attack using Gear Second to try to defeat Magellan

events.title: Magellan's Venom Cloud
events.description: Magellan breathes out large amounts of poisonous breath, creating a fog-like cover called Venom Cloud that fills the area. This poisonous fog blurs Luffy's sight, disorients him, and slowly weakens him as he inhales the toxic fumes.
events.significance: Demonstrates another deadly application of Magellan's poison abilities that attacks the nervous system and senses, making it nearly impossible for opponents to fight effectively.

events.title: Luffy's Defeat - Completely Poisoned
events.description: Luffy collapses, completely covered in Magellan's deadly poison from head to toe. Magellan declares that Luffy will agonize for 24 hours before dying and descending into 'the real Hell.' The guards prepare to take Luffy's poisoned body to Level 5, Freezing Hell.
events.significance: This marks one of Luffy's most devastating and complete defeats in the entire series. Unlike other battles where he could recover and continue, here he is utterly overwhelmed and faces certain death without intervention. This defeat emphasizes the stakes of the Impel Down arc and Luffy's desperate situation.

quotes.text: There is no way to neutralize the amount of poison you've absorbed. For 24 hours you will agonize, and then you'll descend into the real Hell.
quotes.speaker: Magellan
quotes.context: Magellan's grim pronouncement of Luffy's fate after defeating him with poison

events.title: Bentham's Declaration of Friendship
events.description: After defeating Hannyabal through disguise, Bentham (Mr. 2 Bon Clay) reveals his true identity to Buggy and Galdino. When Buggy questions why he would risk everything to save them, Bentham passionately declares that they are friends and that friendship needs no other reason.
events.significance: This moment showcases Bentham's character growth and establishes the theme of friendship that runs through the Impel Down arc. His selfless dedication to saving his friends, even at great personal risk, becomes crucial to the events that follow.

quotes.text: They are friends! We need no further reason!
quotes.speaker: Bentham (Mr. 2 Bon Clay)
quotes.context: Bentham's passionate declaration about why he's risking everything to save Buggy and Mr. 3

events.title: Luffy Taken to Level 5 - Freezing Hell
events.description: The guards transport Luffy's unconscious, poisoned body to Level 5 of Impel Down, known as Freezing Hell. The prisoners immediately recognize his condition as the result of Magellan's poison treatment and declare him as good as dead.
events.significance: This sets up Luffy's location for his eventual rescue by Bentham and treatment by Emporio Ivankov. The extreme cold of Level 5 adds another layer of danger to Luffy's already critical condition.

events.title: Ace Hears Luffy's Voice
events.description: From his cell in Level 6, Portgas D. Ace raises his head as he hears Luffy's agonized cries echoing through Impel Down. Though isolated and receiving no information about what's happening above, Ace senses something is wrong.
events.significance: This emotional moment emphasizes the bond between the brothers and Ace's helplessness in his current situation. It foreshadows the eventual revelation that Luffy has been fighting desperately to save him.

quotes.text: I'm going to save Ace no matter what!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's unwavering determination to rescue his brother

quotes.text: There is no way to neutralize the amount of poison you've absorbed. For 24 hours you will agonize, and then you'll descend into the real Hell.
quotes.speaker: Magellan
quotes.context: Magellan's grim declaration after defeating Luffy

quotes.text: They are friends! We need no further reason!
quotes.speaker: Bentham (Mr. 2 Bon Clay)
quotes.context: Bentham's passionate declaration about the value of friendship

quotes.text: Gomu Gomu no... Jet Twin Pistol!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

themes.description: Luffy willingly faces certain death from poison in his desperate attempt to reach Ace, showcasing his willingness to sacrifice everything for those he loves. His defeat emphasizes that determination alone isn't always enough.
themes.symbolism: The poison covering Luffy represents the overwhelming obstacles and sacrifices required to save someone you love.

themes.description: Bentham's declaration that friendship needs no reason perfectly encapsulates the arc's theme. He risks his life to save Buggy and Galdino simply because they are friends, mirroring Luffy's quest to save Ace.
themes.symbolism: Bentham's actions parallel Luffy's mission, showing that true friendship means being willing to sacrifice for others.

themes.description: Despite using Gear Second, Luffy is completely overwhelmed by Magellan. This episode demonstrates that raw determination and existing abilities aren't always sufficient, foreshadowing Luffy's need to grow stronger.
themes.symbolism: Magellan's poison represents obstacles that cannot be overcome through force alone, requiring different approaches and help from others.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy faces one of his most complete defeats, pushed to the absolute limit of his abilities and beyond. His unwavering determination to save Ace despite certain death showcases his character's core values.

characterSpotlights.development: Magellan demonstrates why he is considered one of the most formidable opponents in Impel Down, completely defeating Luffy and showcasing multiple poison techniques. His duty-bound nature is emphasized.

Completely defeats Luffy with overwhelming poison

quotes: There is no way to neutralize the amount of poison you've absorbed. For 24 hours you will agonize, and then you'll descend into the real Hell.

characterSpotlights.development: Bentham shows tremendous character growth, demonstrating that his friendship with Luffy and the others has transformed him. His selfless actions and passionate declaration of friendship become pivotal to the arc.
keyActions: Reveals true identity to Buggy and Galdino
quotes: They are friends! We need no further reason!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the battle sequences between Luffy and Magellan with additional action scenes and reaction shots not present in the manga.
Additional dialogue and inner monologue added to emphasize the emotional weight of Luffy's defeat.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts only a portion of Chapter 535, with the content split across episodes 436 and 437, allowing for extended battle animation.
Magellan is considered one of the few arc antagonists that Luffy never truly defeats in direct combat, making this one of Luffy's most definitive losses.
The opening song 'Kaze wo Sagashite' by Mari Yaguchi initially aired without crediting the singer for episodes 426-429, which was corrected on the DVD release.

trivia.fact: Episode 436 aired on January 31, 2010 in Japan with a TV rating of 10.7%, ranking 3rd for the week.
